meanings.definition: To outwit or outsmart someone through cunning or deceit.
meanings.sent1: She was outscheming her opponent in the chess game.
meanings.sent2: The detective was outscheming the criminal to solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The fox was outscheming the rabbit in a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her plan for the surprise party was outscheming everyone's expectations.
meanings.sent5: The clever squirrel was outscheming the birds to get the most nuts.

meanings.definition: The act of outsmarting or deceiving someone through clever tactics.
meanings.sent1: His outscheming of the security system was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The outscheming in the spy movie kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent3: The cat's outscheming of the dog led to a hilarious chase around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The politician's outscheming in the election was compared to a game of chess.
meanings.sent5: The magician's outscheming of the audience left everyone in awe.
